alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee; Menifee; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Powell, central Estill, southwestern Menifee, northeastern Lee and western Wolfe Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 104 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hardwick, or near Stanton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stanton and Fitchburg around 110 PM EDT. Knowlton, Furnace, Rosslyn, Cat Creek, Cobhill and Patsey around 115 PM EDT. Rogers Chapel, Bowen, Pilot and See around 120 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Nada, Slade, Lombard, Standing Rock, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Natural Bridge S.P., Glencairn, Koomer Ridge Campground, Haystack, Jenson, Red River Gorge, Pine Ridge, Rogers and Torrent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
